title: Conor McGregor has BOTTLE thrown by Dagestani national during press conference in Moscow
text:
An enraged Dagestani national launched a plastic bottle at Conor McGregor during a press conference because of offensive comments the Irishman made about the area.

In Moscow on Thursday McGregor said: 'I wouldn't go to Dagestan to take a s**t, and that is the truth.'

On Friday a man from the Russian federal district took issue with his comments and confronted him.

Conor @TheNotoriousMMA McGregor dodges a bottle thrown by angry Dagestani man seeking answers for his words about his homeland and @TeamKhabib pic.twitter.com/4kJZUOU58j — RT Sport (@RTSportNews) October 25, 2019

On Friday a man from Dagestan took issue with Conor McGregor's comments and threw bottle

He shouted: 'Do you remember what you say about Dagestan people yesterday? If you hate Khabib and his team, why do you say bad things about [all Dagestani] people?'

The Dubliner remained calm and tried to reason that his comments were made off the back of slurs from people in his rival Khabib Nurmagomedov's homeland.

'The disrespect they showed me in the build up to the fight, they sold items in the grocery [store] with my face on it,' he said, referring to a Dagestani supermarket labelling frozen chickens with his name.

The enraged man retorted: 'All the people? My father, my brother, you think are all cowards?' to which McGregor continually replied: 'Yes'.

McGregor remained calm and said the comments were a response to slurs from Dagestan

This week, the Irishman vowed to 'go through the entire roster like a chainsaw through butter'

'Why cowards? My father?! What did he do to you?! My brother, what did he do to you?!', the fiercely patriotic man responded before hurling a bottle and being ushered away by security.

The 31-year-old fighter wasn't flustered and continued to take questions around his return to the UFC.

The Irishman will be fighting in Las Vegas in January next year. He has not stepped into the cage since losing to Khabib in the same location last October.

In the same Thursday presser in which he spoke provocatively about Dagestan, the 'Notorious' said: 'I am going to go through the entire roster like a chainsaw through butter.'

A rematch with Khabib, who has since defended the lightweight title against Dustin Poirier, is expected to be made at some point.

McGregor has not stepped into the cage since losing to Khabib Nurmagomedov last year

And McGregor took aim at his bitter rival. 'It will happen. I am not waiting around for that man, he is a known pull-out,' he added.

'You can run but you cannot hide. He ran out of the press conference in Moscow last week. It is in his nature. Trust me I am coming for him.

'Where is he now in this country? I fly in, he flies out. Typical.'

Dagestan is a federal subject of Russia, located in the North Caucasus region that borders Georgia, Azerbaijan and the Caspian Sea to the east.

Its nationals are fiercely patriotic and see themselves as separate from Russia.
description: In Moscow on Thursday McGregor said: 'I wouldn't go to Dagestan to take a s**t, and that is the truth' leading a man from the Russian district to launch a bottle at the Irishman in anger on Friday.
